overlook acres this particular bunny will never be eaten  but i have explained in other comments that these bunniesrabbits live in a commune that reflects there natural environment
many new mothers will lose their entire first litter of kits because they dont build the nest properly or they abandon their kits  this is even more dramatic in the winter

unfortunately animals will also be animals and in a commune environment while trying to replicate natural habitat  which by far and large leads to happier and healthier bunnies you will occasionally have dominance issues between does  often that may mean another doe raiding another more submissive rabbits nest
if this happens the kits are unprotected and even if it was 50 or 60 degrees out it is tough for a newborn kit to survive in such a situation
when we identify that this happens the kits are brought inside and hand reared
there are over 20 rabbits in the commune though and rabbits have kits every 27 days  so you dont catch every single one
